intro: Erodium longicaule, commonly known as the slender bedstraw, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with slender, erect stems that are often branched. The plant produces small, pink or purple flowers that bloom from spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Erodium longicaule is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in open fields.
